newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $15.41 bln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $15.41 bln.

text.p: Venezuela's total foreign reserves rose $121 million, or 0.8 percent, in the week to March 24 to $15.410 billion, according to new figures released by the central bank.
Reserves were up from $15.289 billion on March 17, the bank's latest weekly bulletin of indicators showed.
Since the start of the year, reserves have risen $231 million, or 1.5 percent.

Reserves rose $5.5 billion, or 57 percent, last year to $15.179 billion -- largely on soaring international oil prices. Government officials have forecast reserves will continue to grow in 1997, reaching $20 billion by year-end.
